apis.name: MarketData
apis.description: The market data API of MyTestExchange, with different response data types for websocket and REST endpoints. Remark: Only OBJECT (default) and STRING are usually used, but any data type is supported

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeInt
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using INT response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeLong
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using LONG response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeBigDecimal
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using BIGDECIMAL response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeString
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using STRING response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeBoolean
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using BOOLEAN response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeObject
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using OBJECT response data type (default type, explicit here)

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeIntList
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using INT_LIST response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeObjectListMap
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using OBJECT_LIST_MAP response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestEmptyResponseDataType
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using empty response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeRawObject
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using empty response data type

restEndpoints.name: getRestResponseDataTypeExternalObject
restEndpoints.description: A sample REST endpoint using STRING_LIST response data type

websocketEndpoints.name: subscribeTicker
websocketEndpoints.description: Subscribe to stream with OBJECT message type (default, explicit here)

websocketEndpoints.name: subscribeTickertMapListStream
websocketEndpoints.description: Subscribe to stream with OBJECT_MAP_LIST message type
